Text.content: Dictionaries with this name scheme are meant to be default dictionaries for a language. They can either be given as raw text files with one word per line. In this case, use the suffix .txt. Or, they can be given as zipped version of the text file. In this case, use the suffix .zip. The locale should be given as two letter string.

Text.name: Text0
Text.content: Dictionaries with this name scheme are meant to be custom dictionaries for a language. They typically provide specific extensions to the default dictionaries. Here you may specify words like OpenCms, that are not a default English word - but still spelled correctly. The custom dictionaries can either be given as raw text files with one word per line. In this case, use the suffix .txt. Or, they can be given as zipped version of such a text file. In this case, use the suffix .zip. The locale should be given as two letter string.
